definitions.definition: A child between 10 and 12 years of age, at the onset of adolescence.
A chemical or compound that changes into a gas easily.
Evaporating or vaporizing readily under normal conditions.
(of a substance) Explosive.
(of a price etc) Variable or erratic.
(of a person) Quick to become angry or violent.
Fickle.
Temporary or ephemeral.
(of a situation) Potentially violent.
(of a variable) Having its associated memory immediately updated with any changes in value.
(of memory) Whose content is lost when the computer is powered down
Passing through the air on wings, or by the buoyant force of the atmosphere; flying; having the power to fly.
A time when soldiers are not on alert
A small refrigerator in a hotel room, containing drinks and snacks.
Land with peat soil, such as an active or former bog
A mixture of fine solid particles or liquid droplets suspended in a gaseous medium.
An aerosol can.
The payload (e.g. insecticide, paint, oil, cosmetics) and propellant contained by an aerosol can.
A colloidal system in which the dispersed phase is composed of either solid or liquid particles and in which the dispersal medium is some gas, usually air.
To spray with an aerosol.
The spiny lobster
A place where ships are repaired or outfitted.
The quality or state of being inflexible, or not capable of being bent or changed; unyielding stiffness
A split, salted and smoked herring or salmon.
A male salmon after spawning.
(RAF World War II code name) A patrol to protect fishing boats in the Irish and North Seas against attack from the air.
(naval slang) A torpedo.
To prepare (a herring or similar fish) by splitting, salting, and smoking.
(often with capital) A member or supporter of UKIP (UK Independence Party).
Amorous
Lively; light-footed; nimble
A song for a small number of unaccompanied voices; from 13th century Italy.
A polyphonic song for about six voices, from 16th century Italy.
A short poem, often pastoral, and suitable to be set to music.
(percussion) A percussion instrument consisting of a set of tuned metal tubes that are struck with a mallet.
Having an open top.
(of a vehicle) Having no roof, or having a top folded or detached.
Someone who regularly looks after another person, either as a job or often through family responsibilities.
definitions.example: Have you thought of a job as a carer for disabled people?

definitions.definition: Any person or thing that brings stability.
Any substance added to something in order to stabilize it.
A gyroscopically controlled fin or similar device that prevents the excess rolling of a ship in rough seas.
An airfoil that stabilizes the flight of an aircraft or missile.
A piece of backing fabric used in embroidery.
A tusk.
A small tusk sometimes found on the female Indian elephant.
The buttocks.
Nonsense; tosh.
To express contempt; rebuke.
An exclamation of contempt or rebuke.
To pull or drag a heavy object such as a tree or log.
A half-crown coin; its value
A crown coin; its value

A kitchen appliance consisting of a clay pot and its housing with self-contained electrical heating, characterized by a loose-fitting lid, relatively low temperatures, and long cooking times, and used especially in the preparation of stews.
The treasurer of a university, college or school.
A student funded by a bursary.
A vessel or fixture for washing, particularly:
Handwashing, particularly
A liquid used in washing; a lotion; a wash; a rinse.
A washroom: a room used for washing the face and hands.
A room containing a toilet: a bathroom (US) or WC (UK).
A plumbing fixture for urination and defecation: a toilet.
A place to wash clothes: a laundry.
A place where gold is panned.
A paved room in a mortuary where corpses are kept under a shower of disinfecting fluid.
Washing, or cleansing by washing.
Having restricted or rigid views, and being unreceptive to new ideas.
Intolerant, bigoted or prejudiced.
A secondary floor, in between the main floors of a building; entresol.
definitions.example: On our way to the top floor, we stopped at the mezzanine.

definitions.definition: A small window used to light such a secondary floor.
The lowest balcony in an auditorium.
Additional flooring laid over a floor to bring it up to some height or level.
A floor under the stage, from which contrivances such as traps are worked.
Fulfilling an intermediate or secondary function.
definitions.example: To make interconnections easier, we added a mezzanine PCB.

definitions.definition: A chronic disease of the brain and spinal cord characterized by changes in sensation, visual problems, weakness, depression, difficulties with coordination and speech, impaired mobility and disability.
An illegal trader of goods, especially of alcohol.
In the reproductive cycle, the stage after the fertilization of the egg that precedes the development into a fetus.
An organism in the earlier stages of development before it emerges from the egg, or before metamorphosis.
In viviparous animals, the young animal's earliest stages in the mother's body
In humans, usually the cell growth up to the end of the seventh week in the mother's body
A rudimentary plant contained in the seed.
The beginning; the first stage of anything.
(exercise) Exercise with the goal of raising the heart rate.
definitions.example: I did some cardio today instead of lifting weights.

definitions.definition: Cardiovascular; pertaining to the health of the circulatory and respiratory systems.
Bristling, rough, rugged.
Causing horror or dread.
Offensive, disagreeable, abominable, execrable.
definitions.example: The other girls in class are always horrid to Jane.

definitions.definition: A bouillon cube.
A porter at an airport.
The spending by a government in excess of government revenue.
The belt-like region of the celestial sphere approximately eight degrees north and south of the ecliptic which include the apparent path of the sun, moon, and visible planets.
The twelve equal divisions of the zodiacal region into signs or houses, each named for a prominent constellation in the region.
The ecliptic: the belt-like region of the celestial sphere corresponding to the apparent path of the sun over the course of a year.
Any of various astrological systems considered similar to the above.
A circle decorated with the signs of the zodiac.
Not engaging in acts of moral depravity, such as drinking, smoking or carousing.
Alternative spelling of pullout
Fish, shellfish, seaweed, and other edible aquatic life.
Tiresome, tedious or causing fatigue.
definitions.example: Gardening can be wearisome work.

definitions.definition: A stimulant narcotic, derived from cultivated plants of the genus Erythroxylum, in the form of a white powder that users generally self-administer by insufflation through the nose.
Any derivative of cocaine.
One who bathes or swims.
One who gives a bath to another.
Thin, muscular and flexible.
definitions.example: Don't fight him. He may be small, but he's wiry.

definitions.definition: To feed (a baby) milk via the breasts; to suckle; to nurse.
definitions.example: She stopped breastfeeding after a few months.

definitions.definition: (chiefly of a baby) To nurse, to suck milk from a breast.
A person's best performance at a task to date.
definitions.example: His personal best was a seven-minute mile.

definitions.definition: A major road in a town or village, or in a country area.
A major urban road, off which lead many smaller streets, many of them cul-de-sacs.
definitions.example: Living near the main road means you hear a lot of traffic noise.

definitions.definition: High Street; Main Street
To make (an offence) worse or more severe; to increase in offensiveness or heinousness.
(by extension) To make worse; to exacerbate.
To give extra weight or intensity to; to exaggerate, to magnify.
definitions.example: He aggravated the story.

definitions.definition: To pile or heap (something heavy or onerous) on or upon someone.
To exasperate; to provoke or irritate.
Having been the subject of aggravation; frustrated and angry.
Causing trouble or anxiety
definitions.example: The computer has been very troublesome for me. It never works when I need to use it.

definitions.definition: That cannot be fashioned; unshapely, distorted.
Not fashionable
A heavy rain.
definitions.example: They got caught in a downpour without an umbrella and came back soaked.

definitions.definition: To pour down; rain heavily.
All except for some previously mentioned set.
definitions.example: Two of the bolts were loose, but every other bolt I checked was fine.

definitions.definition: Every second/two; each alternate; the second of each pair in turn.
definitions.example: Although I work from home, I visit the office for a meeting every other day.

definitions.definition: Originally, enchantment; magic charm; especially, the effect of a spell that causes one to see objects in a form that differs from reality, typically to make filthy, ugly, or repulsive things seems beauteous.
Alluring beauty or charm (often with sex appeal).
definitions.example: glamour magazines; a glamour model

definitions.definition: Any excitement, appeal, or attractiveness associated with a person, place, or thing; that which makes something appealing.
definitions.example: The idea or being a movie star has lost its glamour for me.

definitions.definition: Any artificial interest in, or association with, an object, or person, through which it or they appear delusively magnified or glorified.
A kind of haze in the air, causing things to appear different from what they really are.
An item, motif, person, image that by association improves appearance.
To enchant; to bewitch.
An edition of a magazine, etc, that was published earlier than the current edition.
A dog that is trained to be of assistance to a blind person and is able to guide him or her.
The study of formal debate; rhetoric
Forensic science
Twofold, having a double purpose or nature.
(of names) Having two separate parts, often adjoined by a line (or sometimes a space), e.g. Wright-Phillips.
Forceful, powerful (like a double-barrelled shotgun).
(Of the weather, air, etc) humid, or hot and humid.
Wet or mouldy
definitions.example: muggy straw

definitions.definition: Having a right angle.
To settle a legal case or other dispute.
To act as a judge.
An enclosure made of bars, normally to hold animals.
definitions.example: The most dangerous prisoners are locked away in a cage.

definitions.definition: The passenger compartment of a lift.
(water polo) The goal.
An automobile.
Something that hinders freedom.
The area from which competitors throw a discus or hammer.
An outer framework of timber, enclosing something within it.
A skeleton frame to limit the motion of a loose piece, such as a ball valve.
A wirework strainer, used in connection with pumps and pipes.
The drum on which the rope is wound in a hoisting whim.
The catcher's wire mask.
A regular graph that has as few vertices as possible for its girth.
To confine in a cage; to put into and keep in a cage.
To restrict someone's movement or creativity.
To track individual responses to direct mail, either to maintain and develop mailing lists or to identify people who are not eligible to vote because they do not reside at the registered addresses.
The lowest grade of seaman in the merchant marine; the grade below able seaman
In a violin-family instrument, the carved wooden plug which sits in the bottom block of the instrument.
The spike of a cello or double bass that makes contact with the floor and supports the weight of the instrument.
A sort of very large nail.
A piece of pointed metal etc. set with points upward or outward.
definitions.example: The trap was lined with spikes.

definitions.definition: Anything resembling such a nail in shape.
An ear of corn or grain.
A kind of inflorescence in which sessile flowers are arranged on an unbranched elongated axis.
(chiefly in the plural) A running shoe with spikes in the sole to provide grip.
A sharp peak in a graph.
A surge in power or in the price of a commodity etc.
The long, narrow part of a high-heeled shoe that elevates the heel.
A long nail for storing papers by skewering them; (by extension) the metaphorical place where rejected newspaper articles are sent.
An attack from, usually, above the height of the net performed with the intent to send the ball straight to the floor of the opponent or off the hands of the opposing block.
An adolescent male deer.
The casual ward of a workhouse.
Spike lavender.
definitions.example: oil of spike

definitions.definition: To fasten with spikes, or long, large nails.
definitions.example: to spike down planks

definitions.definition: To set or furnish with spikes.
To embed nails into (a tree) so that any attempt to cut it down will damage equipment or injure people.
To fix on a spike.
To discard; to decide not to publish or make public.
To increase sharply.
definitions.example: Traffic accidents spiked in December when there was ice on the roads.

definitions.definition: To covertly put alcohol or another intoxicating substance into a drink.
definitions.example: She spiked my lemonade with vodka!

definitions.definition: To add a small amount of one substance to another.
definitions.example: The water sample to be tested has been spiked with arsenic, antimony, mercury, and lead in quantities commonly found in industrial effluents.

definitions.definition: To attack from, usually, above the height of the net with the intent to send the ball straight to the floor of the opponent or off the hands of the opposing block.
To render (a gun) unusable by driving a metal spike into its touch hole.

(football slang) To slam the football to the ground, usually in celebration of scoring a touchdown, or to stop expiring time on the game clock after snapping the ball as to save time for the losing team to attempt to score the tying or winning points.
A card allowing reduced fares for travelling by train.
The ability to solve difficult problems, often in original, clever, and inventive ways.
definitions.example: Ingenuity is one of the characteristics of a beaver.

definitions.definition: Ingenuousness; honesty, straightforwardness
A name acquired from one's father.

(by extension) A name acquired from one's father's, grandfather's or earlier (male) ancestor's first name. Some cultures use a patronymic where other cultures use a surname or family name; other cultures (like Russia) use both a patronymic and a surname.
Derived from one's father.
(by extension) Derived from one's ancestors.
definitions.example: a patronymic denomination

definitions.definition: To reach a conclusion by applying rules of logic to given premises.
To take away; to deduct; to subtract.
definitions.example: to deduce a part from the whole

definitions.definition: (Latinism) To lead forth.
An instance of lazing.
definitions.example: I had a laze on the beach after lunch.

definitions.definition: Laziness.
To be lazy, waste time.
To pass time relaxing; to relax, lounge.
definitions.example: The cat spent the afternoon lazing in the sun.

definitions.definition: Acidic steam created when super-hot lava contacts salt water.
Any of various nonvenomous snakes of the genus Thamnophis, native to America, with longitudinal stripes.
The doctrine that economic systems are controlled by variations in the supply of money.
The political doctrine that a nation's economy can be controlled by regulating the money supply.
A suit, typically made of khaki cotton, and consisting of a long square-cut safari jacket and long or short trousers.
A cylindrical mechanical fastener that attaches multiple parts together by fitting through a hole and deforming the head(s) at either end.
Any fixed point or certain basis.
A light kind of footman's armour.
To attach or fasten parts by using rivets.
To install rivets.
To command the attention of.
To make firm or immovable.
definitions.example: Terror riveted him to the spot.

definitions.definition: The lack of a capacity; an inability.
Legal disqualification.
To tax the patience of, irk, frustrate, vex, provoke, annoy; to make angry.
That exasperates, infuriates, annoys or irritates
An academic subject covering various elements of business, such as accountancy and marketing.
An act of extracting or the condition of being extracted.
A person's origin or ancestry.
Something extracted, an extract, as from a plant or an organ of an animal etc.
An act of removing someone from a hostile area to a secure location.
A removal of a tooth from its socket.
A genre of music characterized by simple and laid-back melodies.
A place of residence for nuns; a convent
A brothel
A member of the Christian clergy; a minister.
Worthy of reverence or respect; reverent.
A genre of art that uses elements of popular culture, often using techniques from commercial art and advertising
A waterproof coat to be worn in the rain.
A condom.
Arrival; onset; a time when something first comes or appears
A robe usually made of terrycloth intended to be worn when one is still damp from bathing or when there is no immediate need to dress fully.
